com.scriptbasic.factories

Class AbstractFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.scriptbasic.factories.AbstractFactory
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Factory
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GenericFactory

    public abstract class AbstractFactory
extends java.lang.Object
implements Factory
    An abstract implementation of the FactoryFactory interface that implements the method create(Class, Class). Concrete subclasses of this class should implement the method set(Class, FactoryManaged) to support the method create(Class, Class)

    Extending classes can not override the method create(Class, Class). If the concrete class has its own implementation of create(Class, Class) then the class has to extend some other class that implements the interface Factory, or itself should implement the interface Factory

    Author:
    Peter Verhas

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public <T extends FactoryManaged> void create(java.lang.Class<T> interf4ce,
                                     java.lang.Class<? extends T> klass)
        Description copied from interface: Factory
        Call this method to create or replace an instance of the class defined by the interface interf4ce. The object will be created calling the default constructor of the class cl4ss.

        If the class can not be instantiated then the implementation will throw BasicInterpreterInternalError.

        To avoid other code to create instance of the class out of the Factory the class should have only one default constructor and it should not be public. If the class has public constructor or has more than one constructors the method will throw BasicInterpreterInternalError

        See also FactoryManaged

        Specified by:
        create in interface Factory
        Parameters:
        interf4ce - the interface that will be used in subsequent calls to Factory.get(Class). Note that this is an error to pass a class that is not an interface and implementations may throw BasicInterpreterInternalError in such a case.
        klass - the class that represents the interface. An instance of this class will be created by the factory.
